Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the effectiveness of cocaine in fighting the coronavirus.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there is no vaccine or medical treatment for the coronavirus.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient scientific evidence or support to prove its validity.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that cocaine can be a cure for the coronavirus without any scientific basis.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in the provided claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of the claim faltering at times.
Exist alternative explanation: There is no evidence of an alternative explanation bias in the provided claim.
